#Text=9. Facing the Scoodlers
#Text=The country was n't so pretty now .
#Text=Before the travelers appeared a rocky plain covered with hills on which grew nothing green .
#Text=They were nearing some low mountains , too , and the road , which before had been smooth and pleasant to walk upon , grew rough and uneven .
#Text=Button-Bright 's little feet stumbled more than once , and Polychrome ceased her dancing because the walking was now so difficult that she had no trouble to keep warm .
#Text=It had become afternoon , yet there was n't a thing for their luncheon except two apples which the shaggy man had taken from the breakfast table .
#Text=He divided these into four pieces and gave a portion to each of his companions .
#Text=Dorothy and Button-Bright were glad to get theirs ; but Polly was satisfied with a small bite , and Toto did not like apples .
#Text=" Do you know , " asked the Rainbow 's Daughter , " if this is the right road to the Emerald City ?

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= No , I do n't , " replied Dorothy , " but it 's the only road in this part of the country , so we may as well go to the end of it .

_	_	_	_

#Text=It looks now as if it might end pretty soon ,  remarked the shaggy man ; " and what shall we do if it does ?

#Text= If I had my Magic Belt , " replied Dorothy , thoughtfully , " it could do us a lot of good just now .

#Text= It 's a thing I captured from the Nome King one day , and it can do ' most any wonderful thing .

#Text=Is this a fairy country ?

#Text= I should think you 'd know , " said the little girl , gravely .

column1: #Text=" If it was n't a fairy country you could n't have a fox head and the shaggy man could n't have a donkey head , and the Rainbow 's Daughter would be invis'ble .

#Text= You do n't seem to know anything , Button-Bright .

_	_	_	_

#Text= Then Toto 's invis'ble , " declared the boy , and Dorothy found he was right .

column1: #Text=Toto had disappeared from view , but they could hear him barking furiously among the heaps of grey rock ahead of them .
#Text=They moved forward a little faster to see what the dog was barking at , and found perched upon a point of rock by the roadside a curious creature .

#Text=It had the form of a man , middle-sized and rather slender and graceful ; but as it sat silent and motionless upon the peak they could see that its face was black as ink , and it wore a black cloth costume made like a union suit and fitting tight to its skin .
#Text=Its hands were black , too , and its toes curled down , like a bird 's .
#Text=The creature was black all over except its hair , which was fine , and yellow , banged in front across the black forehead and cut close at the sides .
#Text=The eyes , which were fixed steadily upon the barking dog , were small and sparkling and looked like the eyes of a weasel .
#Text=" What in the world do you s'pose that is ?

#Text= asked Dorothy in a hushed voice , as the little group of travelers stood watching the strange creature .

column1: #Text=The thing gave a jump and turned half around , sitting in the same place but with the other side of its body facing them .
#Text=Instead of being black , it was now pure white , with a face like that of a clown in a circus and hair of a brilliant purple .
#Text=The creature could bend either way , and its white toes now curled the same way the black ones on the other side had done .
#Text=" It has a face both front and back , " whispered Dorothy , wonderingly ; " only there 's no back at all , but two fronts .

#Text= No , " replied the shaggy man ; " it worked on strings and was made of wood .

_	_	_	_

#Text= Wonder if this works with strings , " said Dorothy ; but Polychrome cried " Look !

_	_	_	_
58-17	4053-4057	Look	_	_	_	_
58-18	4058-4059	!	_	_	_	_

#Text= for another creature just like the first had suddenly appeared sitting on another rock , its black side toward them .

_	_	_	_

#Text= Ca n't tell , Polly , " replied Dorothy .

column1: #Text=" Let 's ask ' em . "
#Text=The creatures flopped first one way and then the other , showing black or white by turns ; and now another joined them , appearing on another rock .
#Text=Our friends had come to a little hollow in the hills , and the place where they now stood was surrounded by jagged peaks of rock , except where the road ran through .
#Text=" Now there are four of them , " said the shaggy man .
#Text=" Five , " declared Polychrome .
#Text=" Six , " said Dorothy .
#Text=" Lots of ' em !

#Text= cried Button-Bright ; and so there were -- quite a row of the two-sided black and white creatures sitting on the rocks all around .
